_instructions: Add your work experience here. Copy the experience object for each job.

experiences.title: Reliability Engineer (Hardware)
experiences.description:
• Orchestrated DFMEA for battery cooling tube coatings, producing a validation plan that projected $28M in lifecycle
savings.
• Devised accelerated life-stress models, precisely calculating test duration & sample size to validate reliability.
• Investigated busbar insulation failure modes; executed material validation studies (DSC, DMA, ΤΜΑ, TGA, EDS),
ensuring durability in Mini trucks.
• Validated conformal coating materials via HTHE, thermal shock & coolant dunk tests, securing $5M annual savings.
• Directed field failure analysis programs, isolating root causes, mitigating risk factors, and extending product uptime.
• Partnered with semiconductor teams to evaluate power modules under liquid-cooled conditions, improving module
resilience.
• Formulated reliability protocols for immersion cooling systems, introducing in-situ corrosion & HTOL validation.
• Conducted thermomechanical characterization of substrate and die attach per OCP standards, enhancing design
robustness.
• Developed predictive reliability dashboards integrating test data with statistical models, enabling proactive failure
prevention.

experiences.title: Senior Design Engineer
experiences.company: Quest Global Engineering Services (for Wabtec Corporation)
experiences.description:
• Delivered Product Definition Engineering (PDE) support for locomotive systems, accelerating new product launches.
• Modeled and optimized sheet metal, piping, tubing, and wire harness systems in NX and Pro-E, streamlining designs
and reducing rework cycles by 15%.
• Created and revised 3D models and 2D drawings to support new and legacy locomotive product development.
• Managed and updated Bill of Materials (BOM) in Teamcenter, ensuring configuration accuracy, revision control, and
seamless linkage between CAD data and production assemblies.
• Administered Engineering Change Requests (ECRs) and Engineering Change Notices (ECNs) in Teamcenter PLM,
cutting change turnaround time by 20%.
• Drafted manufacturable designs aligned with ASME Y14.5 GD&T and welding codes, ensuring compliance and re-
ducing shop floor issues.
• Coordinated with cross-functional engineering and manufacturing teams, driving smooth design-to-production hand-
offs.
• Conducted design reviews to validate feasibility, manufacturability, and cost before release.
• Expanded locomotive domain expertise, supporting continuous design enhancements across multiple platforms.
• Synthesized supplier and vendor feedback into revised component specifications, reducing recurring design deviations.
• Supported root-cause analysis and corrective actions for field issues to enhance product reliability.

experiences.title: Junior Product Designer
experiences.description:
• Designed optimized routes for fuel feed pumps, radiator fans, tail lamps, and starter motors, minimizing clash risks
with the vehicle body and improving assembly efficiency.
• Reduced wiring harness cost by 10% through elimination of excess lengths, optimization of connector layouts, and
standardization of routing paths.
• Converted STEP files into client-specific CAD models, accelerating design delivery timelines and reducing revision
cycles by 15%.
• Developed and maintained detailed Bill of Materials (BOM) for mechanical and electrical assemblies, ensuring 100%
accuracy between CAD models, ERP entries, and production documentation.
• Coordinated BOM change requests (ECR/ECN) to align design revisions with procurement and manufacturing up-
dates, minimizing part obsolescence.
• Inspected fitment of floor panels, clutch housing, and fender assemblies, ensuring seamless integration of sub-assemblies
and adherence to GD&T standards.
• Prepared QC inspection reports, FEA analyses, and client presentations, expediting design validation and approval
processes.
• Introduced lightweight design iterations for plastic and sheet metal components, improving manufacturability and
reducing material cost by 8%.
• Collaborated cross-functionally with sourcing and production teams to validate BOM completeness and support cost
estimation for prototype builds.
• Standardized part numbering and material specifications across multiple projects, reducing engineering rework and
improving traceability during design audits.
